CatDescriptText: Johnnie Washington, manager, New Granada Theatre, 59 Arthur Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1958, pg. 6 with question: "Do you believe the trouble in Middle East will start an atomic world war?" answer reads: "Yes, it looks like the start of a world war."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Johnnie Washington wearing small moustache, striped shirt, and jacket with light colored handkerchief and pen in left breast pocket, standing in front of light colored wall with sign on left that reads "Adults 70c Children 25c", possibly the New Granada Theater
